alert.note: Alert for Athens; Gallia; Jackson; Meigs; Morgan; Perry; Vinton; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 3:32AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Meigs, Washington, Morgan, southeastern Perry, northern Gallia, Jackson, eastern Vinton, Athens, western Wirt, northern Jackson, Wood, Pleasants, northwestern Ritchie, northern Mason and northwestern Tyler Counties through 415 AM EDT... At 332 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from McConnelsville to 6 miles east of South Webster. Movement was east at 70 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Parkersburg, Athens, Marietta, Belpre, Jackson, Wellston, Nelsonville, Point Pleasant, Gallipolis, Ripley, St. Marys, Pomeroy, Glouster, McConnelsville, Mcarthur, Oak Hill, Beverly, Rio Grande, Albany and Elizabeth. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 136 and 186. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 1 and 17. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Athens; Gallia; Jackson; Meigs; Morgan; Perry; Vinton; Washington
